panels.description: Number of failed scrapes within the current time range.
panels.title: Exporter failures

panels.description: A summary of drive health. Drives with bad health will add new red numbers to this display, labeled appropriately.
panels.title: Drive health summary

panels.description: The total power draw reported by the ILO(s) in watts.
panels.title: Power Draw

panels.description: A summary of temperature status. Bad temperature statuses will add new red numbers to this display, labeled appropriately.
panels.title: Temperature summary

panels.description: A summary of CPU health. Unhealthy CPUs will add new red numbers to this display, labeled appropriately.
panels.title: CPU health summary

panels.description: A summary of fan health. Unhealthy fans will add new red numbers to this display, labeled appropriately.
panels.title: Fan health summary

panels.description:
A summary of memory health. Memory modules in bad health will add new red numbers to this display, labeled appropriately.

Memory modules with status "notPresent" are hidden.
panels.title: Memory health summary

panels.description: A summary of drive status. Drives with status other than "Ok" will add new red numbers to this display, labeled appropriately.
panels.title: Drive status summary

panels.description: The number of currently crossed temperature thresholds.
panels.title: Crossed Temperature thresholds

panels.description:
A generalization of the combined CPU power your server(s). 

This doesn't mean much on its own, but it looks cool.
panels.title: CPU summary

panels.description: A summary of memory status. Memory modules with status other than "good" or "notPresent" or "spare" will add new red numbers to this display, labeled appropriately.
panels.title: Memory status summary

panels.description: A summary of drive SMART status. Drives with bad SMART status will add new red numbers to this display, labeled appropriately.
panels.title: Drive SMART summary

panels.description: The total power draw reported by the ILO(s) in watts.
panels.title: Power Draw

panels.description: Ambient temperature averaged across all nodes.
panels.title: Ambient temperature

panels.description:
A generalization of the combined memory capacity of your server(s). 

This doesn't mean much on its own, but it looks cool.
panels.title: Memor summary

panels.description:
A generalization of the combined drive capacity of your server(s). 

This doesn't mean much on its own, but it looks cool.
panels.title: Drive summary

panels.description:
Temperature of each sensor. 

NOTE: The color shown is a generalization, and not representative of whether the temperature has exceeded thresholds.
panels.title: Temperature stats

panels.description:
Temperature represented as a percentage of the provided temperature threshold.

This can be used to identify sensors that are closest to or have already crossed said threshold.

targets.expr: (ilo_temperature_celsius{$ilo_ident=~"$node"} / on($ilo_ident, id) (ilo_temperature_threshold{$ilo_ident=~"$node"} > 0)) * on($ilo_ident, id) group_left(label, threshold_type) ilo_temperature_info{$ilo_ident=~"$node"}

(ilo_temperature_celsius{$ilo_ident=~"$node"} / on($ilo_ident, id) (ilo_temperature_threshold{$ilo_ident=~"$node"} > 0)) * on($ilo_ident, id) group_left(sensor_locale, threshold_type) ilo_temperature_info{$ilo_ident=~"$node"}

panels.title: Temperature Threshold Proximity

panels.description: Detailed information about every reported temperature sensor.
panels.title: Temperature Sensor Info

panels.description: Temperatures plotted on an x/y graph, similar to the 2d temperature graph in the ILO control panel.

targets.expr: ilo_temperature_celsius{$ilo_ident=~"$node"} * on($ilo_ident, id) group_left(x_pos, y_pos, label, sensor_locale, condition, threshold_type) ilo_temperature_info{$ilo_ident=~"$node"}

panels.title: Temperature map

panels.description: A graph showing the temperatures of various sensors over time.
panels.title: Temperatures

panels.description: A graph of various fan speeds over time.
panels.title: Fan speed

targets.expr: 255 > (ilo_drive_temperature{$ilo_ident=~"$node"} * on($ilo_ident, id) group_left(port, box, bay, vendor, serial) ilo_drive_info{$ilo_ident=~"$node"}) > 0

list.description: Pick the label you wish to uniquely identify your ILO(s). For example, you could change this to job instead of instance, or some other identifier you added in your config.
list.label: ILO Identifier
list.name: ilo_ident
